main event: On 27 July 1948 in Springfield, Ohio, a female civilian reported sighting a round object, described as 'Rango Balls' which were 6-8/10 to 1/6 the size of the full moon, traveling north at 2200 hours.
interesting points: The object was described as 'brill: red tail of 2 deg' and 'traversed in a straight line' at a great height, suggesting it was a bright meteor.
The incident is categorized as having a high probability of being an astronomical event according to Dr. Hynek's evaluations extracted from the Project Grudge report.
The report also mentions a 'rare-type brill' and a 'collision' implying the meteor was crossing the orbit of the earth on its way toward the sun.
The document includes references to 'Unconventional Aircraft' and was addressed to the Director of Intelligence, General Staff, Department of the Army in Washington, D.C.
The sighting did not have any evident explanation, which adds to the mystery of the event.
